revised_title: Observations on the Mortality and Health in York: A Comparative Analysis of Births and Deaths from 1728 to 1776
tldr: This study examines the mortality and health trends in York from 1728 to 1776, comparing the number of births and deaths, and identifying factors contributing to the city's population growth and health improvements. The research highlights the importance of factors such as inoculation, improved medical treatments, and increased attention to public health in enhancing the overall well-being of the population.
